s2.title: Unpacking the Files
s2.p: &ParserName; is packaged as a ZIP file for all platforms and operating systems. The parser release is also packaged as Tar GZip files as a convenience for UNIX users. You can extract the ZIP files using the Java jar command to unpack the distribution.
s2.source: jar xf &ParserName;-bin.&parserversion;.zip jar xf &ParserName;-src.&parserversion;.zip jar xf &ParserName;-tools.&parserversion;.zip
s2.p: All of these commands creates a sub-directory called "&parserdir;" in the current directory.

s2.title: Files in the Binary Package

tr.td: Jar file containing all the parser class files
Jar file containing all sample class files
Directory containing sample XML data files
Directory containing Javadoc API for parser framework
Directory containing the source code for the samples

s2.note: To use &ParserName; you do not need the source files. However, if you want to recompile the sources you need to download the source package.

s2.title: Files in the Source Package

tr.td: Batch file for invoking Ant build for Windows users
Shell script for invoking Ant build for UNIX users
Ant build file -- read README file before building
Web page redirect required for building documentation
Current open issues that need to be resolved
Directory containing sample XML data files
Directory containing documentation, in XML form
Directory containing source code for samples
Directory containing source code for parser and supplemental APIs

s2.note: In order to compile the source code using Ant or build the release packages, you must download the &ParserName;-tools.&parserversion;.zip package and extract it in the same directory where you extracted the source package.
